sub_title: PhD Candidate Medieval History - Al-Andalus at Radboud University
summary:
I have several international and intercultural work experiences in project development, management, and implementation. My communication and presentation skills help me to build and maintain a relevant network of people in the Netherlands and abroad. Since I have studied and worked in countries like Germany, Algeria, Morocco and Lebanon, I developed full professional working skills in Arabic, English, Dutch and German and working knowledge in French, Spanish and Persian. My field of interest concerns the Middle East and North Africa and I have gained profound knowledge in its languages, cultures, politics and societies.

•	Broad experience in project development, management and implementation
•	English, Dutch, German, French, Arabic, Spanish and Persian
•	Profound knowledge of politics and societies of the Middle East
•	Hands-on mentality and result oriented
•	Strongly commited to human rights
•	Creative person with a good sense of humour 

I am also artistically busy. I create paintings, metal constructions, photographies and more recently I started to develop a short documentary. Apart from that, one of my passionate hobbies is improvisational theater. My creativity is reflected in my work in the range of ideas and solutions I come up with. See pictures below for an impression.  

If you are looking for a project manager/officer in the development, humanitarian or cultural sector or for any questions, please contact me on:
cathrienhoijinck@gmail.com 
+31640834307
